SENT.plain: Type 2 diabetes is increasing in all populations and all age groups across the world
Areas undergoing rapid westernisation and rapid nutrition transition are seeing the greatest increases in prevalence suggesting that environmental factors are important
Studies from around the world have shown that dietary modification for the prevention of T2DM can be successful; however which dietary factors are important remains to be fully elucidated

The WHO, ADA, and Diabetes UK have developed guidelines for the prevention of T2DM even though the WHO states that data from lifestyle modification programmes does not allow for the disentanglement of dietary factors
The aim of this focused review is to evaluate the current dietary recommendations for the prevention of T2DM
In addition we aim to explore the available evidence from both observation studies and clinical trials to determine whether these recommendations are appropriate
